name: GetProjectMemberships
description:
Fetch project membership records from Asana.

Retrieve compact information about project memberships for a specified project in Asana.

parameters.name: project_unique_identifier
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the project to fetch memberships for.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

parameters.name: user_identifier
parameters.description: A string identifying a user, either "me", an email, or the user's gid.

value_schema.description: A string identifying a user. This can either be the string "me", an email, or the gid of a user.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: The number of objects to return per page (between 1 and 100).

value_schema.description:
Results per page.
The number of objects to return per page. The value must be between 1 and 100.

parameters.name: page_offset_token
parameters.description: Token for pagination to retrieve the next set of results. Use the token from a previous response to get subsequent pages.

value_schema.description:
Offset token.
An offset to the next page returned by the API. A pagination request will return an offset token, which can be used as an input parameter to the next request. If an offset is not passed in, the API will return the first page of results.
*Note: You can only pass in an offset that was returned to you via a previously paginated request.*

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: List of properties to include in the response. Use a comma-separated list to specify optional properties to be included in the response.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable pretty formatting for the response output. Useful for debugging as it adds line breaks and indentation, making it more readable. Note: This increases response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.
